name: sys::io::kernel_copy::linux::copy_regular_files::probe_copy_file_range_support

core::ptr::null_mut.doc:
Creates a null mutable raw pointer.

 This function is equivalent to zero-initializing the pointer:
 `MaybeUninit::<*mut T>::zeroed().assume_init()`.
 The resulting pointer has the address 0.

 # Examples

 ```
 use std::ptr;

 let p: *mut i32 = ptr::null_mut();
 assert!(p.is_null());
 assert_eq!(p as usize, 0); // this pointer has the address 0
 ```

sys::pal::unix::cvt.doc:
Converts native return values to Result using the *-1 means error is in `errno`*  convention.
 Non-error values are `Ok`-wrapped.

core::fmt::Arguments::<'a>::from_str.doc:
Create a `fmt::Arguments` object for a single static string.

 Formatting this `fmt::Arguments` will just produce the string as-is.

core::panicking::panic_fmt.doc:
The entry point for panicking with a formatted message.

 This is designed to reduce the amount of code required at the call
 site as much as possible (so that `panic!()` has as low an impact
 on (e.g.) the inlining of other functions as possible), by moving
 the actual formatting into this shared place.
